common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report failures to download models, launch Pieces OS, or open the desktop app. This occurs across Windows and MacOS, potentially due to incompatible versions, unsuccessful installations, or issues with specific chipsets like M1. Solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS version, clean reinstallation, providing logs for analysis, and ensuring compatibility with the system architecture.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problem:** Surya Sengupta reported issues with Ollama failing to install in Pieces OS.

**Key points raised:**

* User updated to Pieces OS version 11.1.0, which included Ollama stability improvements.
* Problem persisted after update and clean reinstall.
* User provided log file (log-02102025.txt).
* Mark from Pieces requested additional support logs.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Update to Pieces OS version 11.1.0.
* Clean reinstall.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is not yet resolved, user still experiencing problems.
* Additional support logs requested.

**Next Steps:**

* User to provide requested support logs for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User, @GetReal444, is experiencing an issue booting up the Pieces OS application.
* The issue may be related to a previously resolved problem (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/620).

**Problems Identified:**

* The user cannot boot up the Pieces OS application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support bot directed the user to related issues and helpful resources.
* Mark, a support team member, offered to schedule a call with the user and requested additional information about the issue.
* Mark also suggested zipping and sending a specific folder from the user's machine for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear if the user provided the requested information or scheduled a call with Mark.
* The issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue appears to be a continuation of a previously resolved issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/620).
* Mark suspects there may be a new issue that needs to be investigated.

Please be aware that I am an AI chatbot and cannot resolve technical issues directly. I recommend contacting the Pieces support team for further assistance with this issue.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (@PASimmons) experienced issues with Pieces OS not running on their M1 Mac.
* Support agent (@mark-at-pieces) responded and suggested steps to troubleshoot the issue.
* Steps included:
    * Killing related processes in Activity Monitor.
    * Providing logs from `/Users/{USERNAME}/Library/com.pieces.os/production/Support`.
    * Ensuring correct architecture (Apple Silicon) during reinstallation.
    * Real-time debugging option through calendar link.
* User confirmed they followed the instructions and reinstalled using the Apple Silicon download link, resolving the issue.
* Support agent (@mack-at-pieces) marked the issue as resolved and referred to ongoing announcement #615 for further information.

**Outcome:**

* Issue resolved successfully.
* User confirmed Pieces for developers running fine.

**Current Status:**

* Issue closed. 
* Announcement #615 likely provides further details related to the resolved issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch on MacOS and Windows
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch on MacOS and Windows after updating to recent versions. The issue seems to be related to incorrect architecture installation (Intel vs. Apple Silicon) on MacOS. Reinstalling the correct version for the architecture often resolves the issue. For persistent problems, users are encouraged to provide logs and engage in further debugging with support.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with the Pieces Desktop App, including premature saving of conversation titles, freezing on Linux, and installation/launch failures on MacOS. Solutions involved bug fixes, workarounds like disabling on-screen keyboards, and reinstallation with correct architecture.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## Summary of Github Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @seantiz reported an issue with "odd behavior" in the Pieces app.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific nature of the "odd behavior" is not described.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A patch was released for the copilot & desktop app in v3.3.5 and 3.3.6.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It's unclear if @seantiz updated the app and tested the fix. 

**Next Steps:**

* Encourage @seantiz to update the app and report back on the outcome.

related_issues.title: Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Freezing on Linux Mint

**Key Points:**

* User @94tejas reported the Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces support team.
* The team identified a related Flutter issue causing the freeze.
* A workaround was suggested involving disabling the on-screen keyboard.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app freezes on specific versions of Linux Mint due to a Flutter issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disable the on-screen keyboard as a workaround.
* A Flutter hotfix is expected to be released soon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being tracked by the Pieces team.
* A permanent fix is expected in the upcoming Flutter hotfix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with links to relevant resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues with launching both the Pieces OS and Desktop applications on various operating systems.  This includes error messages and complete failure to launch.  Solutions are currently being explored by the Pieces support team, including requesting user-specific information and logs for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results
related_issues.text:
Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Search Upgrade in Pieces App

**Key Points:**

* User @hovek reported an issue with the search functionality in Pieces.
* Pieces support team acknowledged the issue and the need for improvement.
* Major search upgrade is planned for the end of the quarter.

**Problems Identified:**

* Current search can be confusing and ineffective.
* NCS search focuses on semantic meaning, not character-by-character matching.
* FTS search only searches content, not metadata.
* Blended search searches both content and metadata with a fuzzy match.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Major search upgrade planned for the end of the quarter.
* Details of the upgrade are not yet available.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being addressed and a fix is expected soon.
* Users can continue to use the existing search functionalities until the upgrade is implemented.

**Additional Notes:**

* The support team provided helpful resources like existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.
* The issue conversation demonstrates the responsiveness and helpfulness of the Pieces support team.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces OS and the desktop app. Problems include failure to open, errors related to localhost and PiecesWebSocketCreator, and the app not launching at all. Proposed solutions involve checking port numbers, reinstalling the app, and contacting the Pieces support team for further assistance and troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: i got this error when opening localhost

i got this error when opening localhost

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

latest

### Early Access Program

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a5eb05e-1c2f-4e2f-aa3a-205d8791de81)
so
when I was opening the localhost for testing I got this problem
i already search for a solution but i cant fix that
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @WhyQwerty23811 reported an issue with being unable to open PiecesOS or the desktop app.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* @mark-at-pieces clarified that Pieces is hosted on 39300, not 1000 and 3000.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was unable to access PiecesOS or the desktop app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was automatically routed to the relevant team member.
* @mark-at-pieces clarified the correct port number for accessing Pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open, awaiting further investigation and resolution by the Pieces team.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with helpful resources while they wait for a response.
* The issue was reported on February 6, 2025.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path: 

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 4c9e86c3-7cd9-4905-84a3-be29a48a5a26
User: Anonymous
Current Version: Unknown
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-50-generic #51-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Nov  9 17:58:29 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User (@Nagarajan2004) reported an issue on 2025-02-03.
* The issue was related to being unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.
* The Pieces support bot provided helpful resources and suggested similar issues.

**Problems identified:**

* User was unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces support team reached out to the user for further troubleshooting.
* A live troubleshooting session was scheduled.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated.
* A live troubleshooting session is scheduled for further diagnosis.

**Additional notes:**

* The specific details of the user's issue are not provided.
* The outcome of the scheduled troubleshooting session is not yet known.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS launch issues:** This appears to be the most common and impactful problem, affecting both MacOS and Windows users. Focus on identifying the root cause (potentially architecture-related) and provide clear solutions, including reinstallation instructions and log analysis.

**Improve communication around Pieces OS updates:** Provide clear guidance on architecture-specific installations to prevent users from downloading the wrong version. Consider an in-app update mechanism or notifications to simplify the process.

**Address Pieces Desktop App freezing on Linux:** Investigate the reported Flutter issue and prioritize its resolution. In the meantime, clearly communicate the workaround of disabling the on-screen keyboard to affected users.

**Review and optimize conversation title saving:** Address the premature saving issue in the Desktop App to improve user experience. Consider adding a confirmation step or a more intuitive saving mechanism.

**Gather more information on "localhost" error:** Investigate the reported error related to localhost and PiecesWebSocketCreator. Request detailed logs and system information from affected users to identify the root cause and provide a solution.

**Continue monitoring model download failures:** While not as frequent, investigate the reported Ollama model download failures. Analyze provided logs and consider potential solutions like network connectivity checks or download source verification.

**Proactively monitor and address newly reported issues:** Regularly review support tickets for emerging trends and prioritize issues based on frequency, impact, and activity level. This will help maintain a positive user experience and prevent minor issues from becoming major problems.
